decks.notes: This deck focuses on the combo of Krark-Clan Ironworks along with cards that generate value when sacrificed like Ichor Wellspring and Scrap Trawler. By utilizing cards like Myr Retriever and Buried Ruin to loop your artifacts, you can generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage to overwhelm your opponent. The engine of the deck revolves around sacrificing artifacts to search for key combo pieces with Ancient Stirrings, while also utilizing cards like Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb for additional control options. The goal is to set up a winning board state by sacrificing and recurring artifacts efficiently.

This deck aims to combo off quickly by utilizing Amulet of Vigor to get extra mana from bounce lands and ramp spells, allowing you to play Primeval Titan as early as turn two. Primeval Titan can search for key lands like Boros Garrison and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion to give your Titan double strike and pump it up for a quick kill. The Amulet Titan deck focuses on fast mana acceleration and explosive plays to overwhelm your opponent before they have a chance to react.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful, hexproof creature with auras to deal damage to the opponent. By protecting your creatures with hexproof and Leyline of Sanctity, the opponent will have a hard time removing them from the battlefield. Ethereal Armor and Daybreak Coronet are key auras that can quickly turn a small creature into a formidable threat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient aggro strategy that is difficult to interact with.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using powerful burn spells and efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent by consistently playing spells that deal direct damage, while controlling the board with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze. The deck focuses on ending the game quickly before the opponent has time to stabilize, utilizing a mix of burn spells and creature damage to secure victory.

The main concept of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures and utilize cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal massive damage. The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to gain additional benefits, such as the ability to pump up creatures with Steel Overseer and the mana acceleration provided by Mox Opal. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful equipment, the deck aims to close out games swiftly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful, hard-to-remove creature by using hexproof creatures and auras to beef up their abilities. By protecting their creatures from targeted removal with cards like Leyline of Sanctity and giving them various buffs like Ethereal Armor and Rancor, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a highly aggressive strategy. With access to cards like Daybreak Coronet and Spirit Mantle, the deck can create a formidable threat that is difficult for the opponent to deal with.

The main focus of this Elves combo deck is to quickly ramp up with mana-producing creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while also generating card advantage with Elvish Visionary and Lead the Stampede. Once there is enough mana on the board, the deck aims to use Ezuri, Renegade Leader's overrun ability and Shaman of the Pack's drain effect to finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. Collected Company provides additional creature options and flexibility. The deck's consistency is further enhanced by the inclusion of Blooming Marsh and Gilt-Leaf Palace to ensure smooth mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly dump cards into the graveyard and take advantage of that by casting powerful creatures like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix for free or at a reduced cost. The deck utilizes cards like Faithless Looting, Goblin Lore, Burning Inquiry, and Street Wraith to fill the graveyard and enable these powerful plays. By being aggressive and utilizing these graveyard synergies, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage, while also having the potential to quickly finish the game with powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Blood Moon and Mana Leak, while also drawing cards and filtering through the deck with Opt, Serum Visions, and Snapcaster Mage. Through the Breach can help cheat Emrakul into play for a game-winning attack, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Sweltering Suns provide additional removal options.

The deck focuses on using discard effects and cycling to quickly fill the graveyard with cards and then utilize the delve ability of Gurmag Angler to cast big threats for low mana costs. The aggressive strategy is supported by creatures like Bloodghast, Flameblade Adept, and Hollow One, which can come down early and put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while disrupting their hand with cards like Burning Inquiry and Collective Brutality. Lightning Bolt provides additional reach and removal options to control the board.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant with disruptive cards like Kitesail Freebooter and Meddling Mage, it aims to apply pressure from the early game and maintain a strong board presence. The use of Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls allows for easy creature deployment, while cards like Noble Hierarch and Reflector Mage provide additional utility. The deck aims to control the game tempo and beat down the opponent before they can stabilize.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on aggressive gameplay utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. By combining powerful Planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil with versatile creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent. Utilizing a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and strong threats, this deck is designed to dominate the battlefield and keep the opponent on the back foot, ultimately leading to victory through consistent and aggressive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures like Archfiend of Ifnir and Horror of the Broken Lands, then use cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to cascade into a Living End, bringing all those creatures back onto the battlefield at once. This combo allows you to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a board full of strong creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Fulminator Mage and Beast Within. The deck aims to win the game through a powerful and explosive graveyard-based strategy.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on generating value through a combination of cheap spells and creatures. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with early threats like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler. The deck can also control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt. Blood Moon serves as a way to disrupt opponents' mana bases, giving the deck an edge in the mid to late game. Overall, this deck is built to be fast, disruptive, and aggressive.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Farseek, Sakura-Tribe Elder, and Search for Tomorrow, in order to cast Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and multiple Mountains. By sacrificing lands, Scapeshift triggers Valakut's ability to deal damage to the opponent, while Primeval Titan can also search for Valakut and increase the damage output. Bloodbraid Elf provides additional card advantage and pressure, making the deck a powerful combo deck aiming to win the game in one explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck revolves around taking extra turns and disrupting the opponent's gameplay. The deck achieves this by using cards like Temporal Mastery, Time Warp, and Part the Waterveil to gain additional turns and dictate the pace of the game. It also includes cards like Exhaustion and Gigadrowse to tap down the opponent's lands and creatures, causing disruption and delaying their game plan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage, Cryptic Command, and Fatal Push for control and removal options. The deck uses Howling Mine and Dictate of Kruphix to draw additional cards and maintain card advantage.
